result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The deft shall commit no violation of criminal law to the level of probable cause "probable cause" shall be the level of proof needed to sustain the sufficiency of the criminal complaint of a misd, or that level of proof needed to sustain a bindover for trial if a felony.
If the DCA is not revoked, the charge shall be dismissed with prejudice.
No revocation may take place without a hearing before the Court with notice served upon all parties.
Deft specifically waives her right to a speedy trial, disposition or any applicable statute of limitations to the charge covered by this DCA.
In the event the expiration date of this DCA has passed, nothing in this DCA or the laws of the State of WI shall prevent the State from seeking revocation of this DCA if the State has filed a motion to revoke this DCA prior to the expiration date.
Deft agrees to maintain his/her current address with the Clerk of Courts office.  Any change shall be updated with the Clerk of Courts office within 72 hours of the change.  The defendant further agrees that any court notice mailed to the most recent address he/she has on with the Clerk of Courts office is notice for any further court hearings on this case.
If all child support arrears are repaid to the custodial parent and the State of Wisconsin, the State has no objection to the defendant's early discharge from the DCA after 2 years have elapsed. 
Defendant shall keep the Sheboygan County Child Support Agency apprised of his employmnet and his whereabouts during the course of the DCA. Failure to do so shall constitute a breach of the Agreement.

Instructions on How to Appear Remotely by Zoom on October 1, 2021 and Waiver.

Motion hearing on October 1, 2021 at 04:00 pm.
This hearing will be conducted by video conference using Zoom. The hearing may be viewed by the public in real time on YouTube by copying and pasting the following link into your web browser: https://www.wicourts.gov/.  Once on the www.wicourts.gov site, Click on the "live stream courts" tab. Scroll down to Sheboygan County and click on the Branch 5 link.

4:23 PM Defendant Robert M Nielson by zoom audio means with attorney Jacob Van Kerkvoorde by zoom means.  Alexandra Kathleen Smathers appeared for the Wisconsin, State of by zoom means.  Atty Van Kerkvoorde has sent a request to ADA Smathers a short time prior to this hearing. Defense would like to extend DCA. State requests time to review defense email. This motion is to revoke DCA. Court adjourns.
